item.title: City Tales: Medieval Era launches in Early Access on May 22
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/city-tales-medieval-era-launches-in-early-access-on-may-22

  • PC

Medieval strategic city builder dated.

Medieval strategic city builder City Tales: Medieval Era will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on May 22, publisher Firesquid and developer Irregular Shapes announced. A demo is available now as part of the “City Builder & Colony Sim Fest” on Steam.

Here is an overview of the game and Early Access release, via Firesquid:

City Tales: Medieval Era will offer an Early Access launch full of content with an intricate economy with over 50 different types of resources and over 60 types of buildings. With its custom 3D procedural engine, which generates each building individually, the player is immersed in a city where each building and each plot is truly unique.

This game lets players step into the role of a medieval lord, directing the shape and growth of their kingdom. Players can try the innovative urban planning tool to draw districts, craft over 60 buildings, and experience the game’s companion system. Builders will grow their settlements from small hamlets to sprawling medieval cities, evolving their creations and eventually building monuments that will truly represent their city.

City Tales: Medieval Era emphasizes the narrative with a cast of companions. These characters work with the player to build the city and whose storyline and growth they get to decide. Player’s decisions shape how each story unfolds, adding a new layer of replayability and immersion to the city-builder genre.

Irregular Shapes plans to expand City Tales: Medieval Era with new content regularly during the Early Access, including more buildings, resources, and a deeper companion system with more narrative elements, maps, and quality-of-life updates. Players who decide to support the Early Access now can also use the Photo Mode to capture their creations and share them with the community on Steam and social media.

item.title: LAN Party Adventures announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/lan-party-adventures-announced-for-pc

LEAP Game Studios has announced LAN Party Adventures, a single-player adventure game that tasks players with setting up lAN parties in various locations and managing the requirements. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2025.

“We’ve been crafting LAN Party Adventures in secret, and we’re excited to finally share it with the world,” said LEAP Game Studios producer Gabriel Shimabuko in a press release. “Our goal is to evoke cherished memories of old-school LAN parties while offering a compelling mystery for players to solve together.”

Here is an overview of the game, via LEAP Game Studios:

About

LAN Party Adventures is a single-player adventure merging storytelling and simulation that takes players back to the early 2000s. In the golden age of massive LAN Parties, strong friendships, and dial-up internet, players will have to set up their own LANs, connect cables and peripherals, and solve the mystery of a friend who’s gone missing.

In LAN Party Adventures, players are tasked with setting up LAN parties in various locations and managing all the requirements. From handling the hardware to plugging the cables, setting up the software, and getting the computers to talk to each other. The game promises a fun blend of straightforward challenges on the simulation side, with a light investigative narrative.

As players work to uncover the truth behind their friend’s disappearance, they’ll need to collaborate with their group, solve puzzles, and follow digital clues. Each new LAN party brings fresh challenges to solve and pieces of the mystery to uncover, as well as a new opportunity to make them larger and funnier by unlocking upgrades and tools.

Players will also be able to set up their own dream LANs in Sandbox Mode, complete with retro-inspired posters, customizable computers, and endless accessories. This creative mode won’t limit creativity and will give players all the tools to set up great setups, from small net-cafes to massive events.

Key Features

  • Adventure Story – A nostalgia-filled single-player adventure with job-sim features.
  • 2000s Tech – Connect VGA cables, manage speeds, avoid viruses, and master the command line.
  • Sandbox Mode – Create LANs in your style.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Painkiller reimagining announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/painkiller-reimagining-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out this fall.

Publisher 3D Realms and developer Anshar Studios have announced Painkiller, a reimagining of the classic first-person shooter franchise, for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC (Steam). It will launch this fall.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The classic Painkiller series is back! Battle through Purgatory in fast-paced cooperative action, wielding infernal weapons against relentless demonic hordes. Condemned for your sins, the Voice of the Creator offers you a chance at redemption. Will you seize it or be lost to darkness?

Painkiller is a reimagining of the classic franchise, featuring cooperative play for up to three players and full offline support. Battle hordes of demons and titanic terrors across richly detailed gothic environments.

Trapped in Purgatory, you are sentenced for your transgressions against Heaven. But the Voice of the Creator gives you a chance to redeem yourself. As one of the Champions, you are to stop the fallen angel Azazel who is about to unleash his demonic armies onto Earth. You will face hordes of enemies, demons with unique powers and three monstrous children of Azazel – the Nephilim.

Will you succeed in your mission and earn your salvation?

Key Features

  • Purgatory Is Your Playground – Jump, dash, and hook across vast biomes while fighting enemies with a host of new and classic Painkiller weapons.
  • Grotesque Terrors Await – Challenge a variety of enemies ranging from hordes of smaller demons to titanic terrors.
  • Unleash the Pain – Utilize tarot cards to enhance your abilities and combine them with other players to obliterate your foes.
  • Unique Characters – Choose between four characters: Ink, Void, Sol, and Roch, whose abilities range across energy, health, power, and damage.

item.title: METAL EDEN demo launches April 8
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/metal-eden-demo-launches-april-8

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

New gameplay trailer released.

A demo for science-fiction first-person shooter METAL EDEN will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on April 8, publisher PLAION and developer Reikon Games announced.

Here are the latest details:

Public Demo Overview

METAL EDEN‘s Mission 0 and 1 will be available for free and for an unlimited period starting April 8 on Steam, PlayStation Store, and Xbox.

Mission 0 introduces players to the core mechanics while teasing the larger mystery behind ASKA’s mission and her unique ability as an android that can be reprinted.
Mission 1, Paradise Lost, builds upon everything players experienced in Mission 0. The mission’s arena encounters start off simple but steadily increase in complexity, challenging players to adapt their strategies. This section also introduces the player upgrade system in two key ways: Body Modules and Weapon Upgrades.

ASKA, a Reprinted Android

The latest METAL EDEN trailer takes players deep into ASKA’s relentless cycle of battle and evolution, following the core gameplay progression that defines her journey.

It opens with a striking scene—ASKA discovering her own lifeless body and extracting her core. This moment introduces the central premise of the game: ASKA dies on her mission, gets reprinted, and tries again, progressing each time and growing stronger.

From there, the action intensifies. ASKA suits up and heads into battle, tearing through enemy lines with her raw power and agility. The trailer reaches its climax with the ultimate show of power—ASKA wielding the game’s most devastating weapon, the Gatling Gun.

This final sequence encapsulates the power fantasy of playing as ASKA at her peak, leaving players eager to step into her role and carve their own path in METAL EDEN. With ASKA’s relentless progression at the heart of METAL EDEN, players will face brutal challenges, evolve their combat abilities, and unleash unstoppable firepower. Stay tuned for more updates as launch approaches.

METAL EDEN presents an adrenaline-fueled science-fiction first-person shooter that explores a world where humanity’s consciousness has transcended the flesh, now residing within robots.

With eight unique missions and a handcrafted universe setting that embraces the cybernetic dimension of life, METAL EDEN plunges players into an artificial world where they’ll dive into cybernetic warfare, control a powerful hyper unit, and uncover the mysteries of a lost paradise.

METAL EDEN is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on May 6.

item.title: City-building strategy game RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/city-building-strategy-game-raev-kingdom-on-the-distant-shores-announced-for-pc

About

Your kingdom, your empire.

Welcome to the world of Nytland, your new home, my Liege!

Design intricate cityscapes across diverse biomes, tackle logistical challenges, and make choices that will define the fate of your people.

There are plenty of elements to build with, from towering castles to quaint hamlets. Go beyond the walls of your first settlement, across multiple regions, building many villages and growing them all into bustling cities, to create a vast trade network that spans the continent. Conquer the surrounding land to expand your area of influence. Your vision will shape an empire that stands the test of time.

RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores pushes the boundaries of city-building—it’s a Kingdom builder, allowing you to build not just one city but many as you construct your kingdom. Every decision matters, from resource management to diplomacy, trade, and citizen welfare. Will you create a utopian paradise, a bustling economic powerhouse, or a militaristic stronghold? The fate of your kingdom is in your hands.

The Fate of a Kingdom

RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores is more than just a typical city-builder—it blends elements of RPG, city building, and grand strategy, making for a novel approach to the genre. As your land grows, dangers will come to threaten your power, from bands of bandits to ancient perils lurking in dungeons and forgotten ruins. Assemble bands of brave adventurers to quell such dangers, as a prosperous kingdom will need strong defenses and a keen mind.

Meet the Raevins

Your charming citizens, known as Raevins, assist in gathering resources, managing towns, and even uncovering hidden secrets across the land. Their distinct personalities and interactions will make them an integral part of your kingdom, fostering a world that feels alive and enchanting. Train them in unique careers, watch them grow, and shape their destinies.

Freedom to Build

Create your dream kingdom, from towering castles to serene gardens and bustling trade hubs. Shape your towns the way you want, making the best of the lands you settle on.

RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores lets you build without the limitation of a grid, place anything you want where you want, paint your roads, and grow your city organically!

RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores offers approachable complexity, making it easy to learn yet rich with depth to master. You begin with a simple village and gradually transform it into an intricate, interconnected realm, balancing strategy and growth as you progress. Build freely in any of your cities and upgrade your buildings through tech advancements as you build

item.title: Locomoto launches April 8 for PC, later in 2025 for Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/locomoto-launches-april-8-for-pc-later-in-2025-for-switch

  • PC
  • Switch

Become the conductor of your very own locomotive.

Train adventure game Locomoto will launch for PC via Steam on April 8, followed by Switch later in 2025, publisher Amplifier Studios and developer Green Tile Digital announced.

“We’re very excited to be releasing Locomoto on PC this April,” said Green Tile Digital CEO Ben Clarke in a press release. “I’m so proud of everything our team has accomplished so far. It’s been quite demanding at times but we’ve also had a lot of fun along the way; really looking forward to sharing that joy with players as we finally arrive at launch in only a few short weeks! We’re incredibly grateful to our community who’ve already given us so much valuable feedback since we released our demo and we can’t wait to invite even more players to join us on our journey.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

About

Created by indie developers Green Tile Digital, Locomoto reimagines the traditional steam train journey as a captivating creative adventure; blending cozy gameplay with charming humor and heart. As the conductor of their very own locomotive, players can explore a lush immersive world, collect resources, craft furniture, and tend to the needs of their spirited passengers—each brimming with entertaining quirks and their own engaging stories.

Whether decorating with paints, wallpaper, and furniture, expanding the train with new wagons, or completing the townsfolk’s requests, every journey offers a unique and relaxing experience set to an original lofi soundtrack.

Key Features

  • All Aboard for Adventure – Don your conductor’s hat and set a course through the whimsically playful world of Locomoto as you discover new stories, deliver packages, and ferry an array of unique furry passengers between stations.
  • Personalize your Journey – Gather resources to craft a variety of cute, cool and cozy furniture to customize your onboard experience. With an exciting array of unlockable outfits and crafting blueprints to be discovered, get creative as you personalize both your steam train and conductor’s look to suit your own unique style.
  • Befriend the Community – Complete requests and tend to the needs of Locomoto‘s quirky residents as you reconnect towns and forge new connections, earning rewards on your journey to discover the passenger’s unique stories and humorous personalities.
  • Relax with Lofi Beats – Enjoy an original lofi soundtrack as you immerse yourself in a cozy world that allows players to progress at their own pace.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Open-world survival horror game I Hate This Place announced for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/open-world-survival-horror-game-i-hate-this-place-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-switch-and-pc

  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

From a new publishing label under Bloober Team.

Publisher Skybound Games and developer Broken Mirror Games, a new publishing label under Bloober Team, have announced I Hate This Place, an open-world survival horror game based on the comic series of the same name. It will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in Q4 2025.

“I love my book I Hate This Place—a labor of horror love with series co-creator and artist Artyom Topiln—so needless to say I’m thrilled to see someone bring it to life in video game form!” said I Hate This Place comic series writer Kyle Starks in a press release. “I can’t wait to get my hands on this game and be trapped on the terrible ranch the book inhabits!”

Bloober Team CEO Piotr Babieno added, “We are always looking to push the boundaries of horror in all its forms, and with this new title under Broken Mirror Games, I Hate This Place is a testament to that vision. With its blend of survival mechanics, gripping storytelling, and a distinct visual identity, we believe I Hate This Place will immerse players in a truly unforgettable nightmare.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

I Hate This Place is an isometric open-world survival horror set in an eerie, unpredictable world that’s twisted beyond comprehension. Playing as Elena, you awaken forces that threaten to shatter everything you knew about reality.

A Surreal Nightmare

Inspired by the award-winning comic book series created by Kyle Starks and Artyom Topilin, I Hate This Place plunges you deep into a supernatural world where the rules of reality come undone.

The playful meets the petrifying in this strange corner of the universe—everything here wants you dead.

Whatever you do, avoid the Horned Man at all costs.

Survival Horror with Day and Night Cycles

Safety is a rare commodity in I Hate This Place. Wild animals, mutated spiders, crazy cultists and deranged outlaws—they’re all just dying to meet you.

Combat rewards ingenuity over brute force. Often outmatched, you’ll need to manipulate your surroundings to even the odds against formidable foes.

Preparation is the name of the game. Resources are scarce, enemies dangerous and unpredictable. You’ll need to craft tools that can help you survive the wilderness long enough to reach ranch house before nightfall.

Because when the night rolls around—hell breaks loose.

Vibrant ’80s-Inspired Comic Book Style

I Hate This Place features bold, vivid colors and unsettling environments, all wrapped up in a gloriously retro ’80s aesthetic with just a hint of camp to lighten the mood.

Each location is lovingly crafted to tell its own disturbing story through stylish visuals that blur the line between reality and nightmare.

Mysteries Worth Uncovering

They say dead men tell no tales. But in this accursed land, every specter has a story, waiting to be unearthed.

Solve individual hauntings and you’ll start to glimpse the horrifying reality lurking at the heart of I Hate This Place.

But tread carefully—some secrets are buried for good reason.

Watch the announcement teaser trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
